shortdesc.ph: Registers a media metadata observer to receive or send metadata.
Registers a media metadata observer to receive or send metadata.
Registers a media metadata observer to receive or send metadata.
Registers a media metadata observer to receive or send metadata.

p.codeblock: void registerMediaMetadataObserver( {required MetadataObserver observer, required MetadataType type});
public abstract int RegisterMediaMetadataObserver(IMetadataObserver observer, METADATA_TYPE type);

section.p: You need to implement the class and specify the metadata type in this method. This method allows you to add synchronized metadata to the video stream for diverse live interactive scenarios, such as sending shopping links, e-coupons, and online quizzes.

You need to implement the class yourself and specify the metadata type in this method. This method allows you to add synchronized metadata to the video stream for interactive live streaming, such as sending shopping links, e-coupons, and online quizzes.

You need to implement the class yourself and specify the metadata type in this method. This method allows you to add synchronized metadata to the video stream for interactive live streaming scenarios such as sending shopping links, e-coupons, and online quizzes.

You need to implement the class and specify the metadata type in this method. This method allows you to add synchronized metadata to the video stream for interactive live streaming scenarios, such as sending shopping links, e-coupons, or online quizzes.

plentry.pd: The metadata type. Currently, only VideoMetadata is supported. See .

The metadata type. Currently only videoMetadata is supported.
The metadata type. Currently only VIDEO_METADATA is supported. See .

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
